title: Calories in a Glass of White Wine
meta_description: Discover calories in a white wine glass (standard 150 ml pour), plus carbs, alcohol details, and variations for different types.
h1: Calories in a Glass of White Wine
assumptions: Standard 150 ml (5 oz) pour of dry white wine (e.g., Sauvignon Blanc or Chardonnay); ~12% ABV, no added sweeteners.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by wine type (dry/sweet), alcohol content, serving size, and brand. Always check bottle labels for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: A standard glass of white wine contains about 123 calories, mostly from alcohol and carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with wine bottle info.

tweaks.label: Sweet white wine (e.g., Riesling with higher residual sugar)
Larger pour (175 ml instead of 150 ml)

faqs.q: How many calories in a white wine glass?
faqs.a: About 123 kcal for a standard 150 ml pour of dry white wine.
Yes, around 3.9 g carbs per glass, mainly from natural sugars.

faqs.q: Are there fats or proteins in white wine?
faqs.a: Negligible—0 g fat and ~0.2 g protein per glass.

faqs.q: How does serving size affect calories in white wine?
faqs.a: A 5 oz (150 ml) glass is ~123 kcal; larger pours like 6 oz add ~20-25 kcal.

faqs.q: Is white wine lower in calories than red?
faqs.a: Similar—both average 120-130 kcal per glass, varying by type and sweetness.
